alert.note: Alert for Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 1:54PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Ferry and east central Okanogan Counties through 230 PM PDT... At 154 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles northeast of Nespelem Community, or 31 miles east of Omak. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Ferry and east central Okanogan Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
